intro: Krynitzkia dichotoma, commonly known as the two-branched krynitzkia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive dichotomous branching pattern. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Krynitzkia dichotoma is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments and is often found in fynbos vegetation.
